Articles.Content:
I discovered some of these sub-forums by typos in the URL box, then I just went through all the forums using the URL box and found all these sub-forums.

[spoiler=The Error]CAKE99, you do not have permission to access this page. This could be due to one of several reasons:


"Your user account may not have sufficient privileges to access this page. Are you trying to edit someone else's post, access administrative features or some other privileged system?
If you are trying to post, the administrator may have disabled your account, or it may be awaiting activation."[/spoiler]


[spoiler=The Sub-forums That Give The Error]
[URL]http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/5[/URL]
[URL]http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/8[/URL]
[URL]http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/9[/URL]

[URL]http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/79[/URL]
[/spoiler]


There were also a lot of sub-forums that give this error.


"Invalid Forum specified. If you followed a valid link, please notify the administrator"

I'd like to know what all the 24 sub-forums are.

They are private areas of the forum. Some are used by moderators, others by experimentals and QA testers, others by the media group, others by Squad people. Some of those forums are private categories of the other private subforums (similar to the public [URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/3-General-KSP"]General KSP category[/URL] with its 5 subforums).

I can't give you a complete list because a) that's private and b) I don't have access to them all.
Have you ever tried trying typing random numbers after "threads" in the URL? A lot of them aren't public.

[quote name='Mad Rocket Scientist']Have you ever tried trying typing random numbers after "threads" in the URL? A lot of them aren't public.[/QUOTE]
Any thread in one of those private subforums will fall into that category. Including everything that's been Fault Vaulted and the threads automatically generated for each reported post.
